intro: Gnaphalium nubigenum, commonly known as cloud-like everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its dense, fluffy white or pale yellow flowers that resemble clouds, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Gnaphalium nubigenum is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and delicate appearance.
